intro: Ornithocephalus archilarum, commonly known as the desert spider plant, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and spiky, reddish-brown flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ornithocephalus archilarum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
